module.name: Dialogs
module.short: Contains common dialogs used in Lazarus LCL applications.

descr.p: dialogs.pp contains classes, types, and routines used to implement common dialogs in an application. This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).
The following components are added to the Lazarus IDE component palette:
Dialogs Tab
Misc Tab

element.name: TMsgDlgType
element.short: Identifies a dialog type or style.

descr.p: TMsgDlgType is an alias to the TMsgDlgType type in uitypes.pas.

element.name: TMsgDlgBtn
element.short: Identifies dialog button types.

descr.p: TMsgDlgBtn is an alias to the TMsgDlgBtn type in uitypes.pas.

element.name: TMsgDlgButtons
element.short: Set with button messages for dialogs.

descr.p: TMsgDlgButtons is an alias to the TMsgDlgButtons type in uitypes.pas.

element.name: mtWarning
element.short: Alias to the TMsgDlgType enumeration value in uitypes.

element.name: mtError
element.short: Alias to the TMsgDlgType enumeration value in uitypes.

element.name: mtConfirmation
element.short: Alias to the TMsgDlgType enumeration value in uitypes.

element.name: mtCustom
element.short: Alias to the TMsgDlgType enumeration value in uitypes.

element.short: Alias to the TMsgDlgBtn enumeration value in uitypes.

element.short: Alias to the TMsgDlgBtn enumeration value in uitypes.

element.short: Alias to the TMsgDlgBtn enumeration value in uitypes.

element.name: mbYesNoCancel
element.short: A set constant with Yes, No, Cancel buttons.
element.descr: A set constant used to show Yes, No, and Cancel buttons on a message dialog.

element.name: mbYesNo
element.short: A set constant with Yes, No buttons.
element.descr: A set constant used to show Yes and No buttons on a message dialog.

element.name: mbOKCancel
element.short: A set constant to show an OK and a Cancel button on a message dialog.
element.descr: A set constant to show an OK and a Cancel button on a message dialog.

element.name: mbAbortRetryIgnore
element.short: A set constant to show an Abort, Retry , Ignore buttons on a message dialog.
element.descr: A set constant to show an Abort, Retry and Ignore buttons on a message dialog.

element.name: MsgDlgBtnToBitBtnKind
element.short: A constant array used to convert the kind of message buttons to the kind of BitButton.

descr.p: This array gives you for each possible button type in a messagebox the corresponding kind of BitButton.
For instance MsgDlgBtnToBitBtnKind[mbYes] has the value of bkYes.
It is the reverse of BitBtnKindToMsgDlgBtn.

element.name: BitBtnKindToMsgDlgBtn
element.short: A constant array used to convert the kind of BitButton to the kind of message buttons.

descr.p: This array gives you for each BitButton the corresponding type of button on a message dialog. For instance BitBtnKindToMsgDlgBtn[bkOK] has the value of mbOK. It is the reverse if MsgDlgBtnToBitBtnKind.

element.name: TDialogResultEvent
element.short: Specifies an event signalled when a result is returned in a dialog.

descr.p: TDialogResultEvent is the type used to implement the OnDialogResult event handler in TCommonDialog.

element.name: TDialogResultEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TDialogResultEvent.Success
element.short: True if the dialog was successfully executed.

element.name: TCommonDialog
element.short: The base type from which other dialogs are derived.

descr.p: TCommonDialog is the base type from which all other dialogs are derived.
Use Create to make an instance of the dialog, and the Execute method to show it to the user. Use the Close method to release it and free the used resources.

element.name: TCommonDialog.SetHandle
element.short: Sets the value for the Handle property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.SetHandle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.IsTitleStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the the Title property.

descr.p: Returns True when Title contains a value other than DefaultTitle.

element.name: TCommonDialog.IsTitleStored.Result
element.short: True when an explicit value has been assigned to Title.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoExecute
element.short: The function that actually takes care of executing the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoExecute.Result
element.short: Returns True if the correct exit button was pressed.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DefaultTitle
element.short: DefaultTitle returns the default title for a dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.GetHeight
element.short: Gets the value for the Height property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.GetHeight.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.GetWidth
element.short: Gets the value for the Width property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.GetWidth.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.SetHeight
element.short: Sets the value for the Height property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.SetHeight.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.SetWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the Width property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.SetWidth.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCommonDialog.ResetShowCloseFlags
element.short: Resets the values in internal state flags for the dialog.

descr.p: Called from the Execute method before the widgetset handle is allocated and the dialog is displayed.

AttachTo is a platform-specific property which provides the form instance which created the dialog. It is used primarily for the MacOS Cocoa interface to provide the window handle needed for the platform.

element.name: TCommonDialog.OnDialogResult
element.short: Event handler signalled when a result is available for the dialog.

descr.p: OnDialogResult is a TDialogResultEvent property with the event handler signalled when a result is available for the dialog.

OnDialogResult is a platform-specific property, and may not be used in all widgetsets. It provides a way for platforms which use native dialogs in their implementation to notify the dialog that a result is availabile.

element.name: TCommonDialog.FCompStyle
element.short: Internal member used to store component style flags.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TCommonDialog, and calls the inherited Create method and adds default Title.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Create.TheOwner
element.short: The owner of the dialog: the component that called it.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Execute
element.short: Displays the dialog and captures the result.

descr.p: Use the Execute method to display the dialog and capture the result.

Execute notifies the Application that a modal display is started, and disables the current form. The widgetset handle is allocated for the dialog, and the DoExecute method is called to process the modal dialog. The form is re-enabled and its active control is re-selected. The Application is notified that the modal display is completed.
The return value is set to True if the OK button was pressed to exit the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Execute.Result
element.short: Returns True if the user pressed the OK button.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Handle
element.short: Operating system Handle for the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.UserChoice
element.short: UserChoice - the value selected by the user.

descr.p: UserChoice is an name property which contains the modal result value returned for the dialog. It uses modal result constants like mrOk, mrCancel, et. al. as defined in the UITypes unit. Its value is updated by methods in the widgetset class when they display and process the dialog for the platform.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Close
element.short: Closes the dialog and frees its resources.

descr.p: Close is a method used to perform actions needed to close the dialog. This can include signalling the OnClose event handler (when assigned and used for the platform). Close frees the widgetset Handle allocated for the dialog.
No actions are performed in the method if a Handle is not allocated for the dialog, or the Close method has already been called.
Close is called from the Execute method when the DoExecute method has been completed, and occurs before the active form is re-enabled and focused.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoShow
element.short: Performs actions needed when the dialog is displayed.

descr.p: DoShow is a method used to perform actions needed when the form for the modal dialog is displayed. DoShow sets an internal flag to indicate that the dialog has been displayed, and signals the OnShow event handler (when assigned).
No actions are performed in the method if the dialog has already been displayed.
DoShow is called from the DoExecute method.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoCanClose
element.short: Performs actions needed to determine if the dialog can be closed.

descr.p: DoCanClose is a method which determines if the dialog can be closed. It updates an internal flag which indicates the method has been called, and signals the OnCanClose event handler (when assigned and supported for the platform).
Use the OnCanClose to implement any required logic to determine if the dialog can actually be closed. The value in the CanClose argument is updated in the event handler.
DoCanClose is called from the DoExecute method when the widgetset class has attempted to close the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoCanClose.CanClose
element.short: True if the OnCanClose event handler determines the dialog can be closed.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoClose
element.short: Performs actions needed when the dialog is closed.

descr.p: DoClose is a method used to perform actions needed when the dialog is closed. It updates an internal flag which indicates the method has been called, and signals the OnClose event handler (when assigned).
DoClose is called from the Close method, and occurs before the widgetset Handle for the dialog is freed.

element.name: TCommonDialog.HandleAllocated
element.short: Returns True if a widgetset handle has been allocated for the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.HandleAllocated.Result
element.short: True if a widgetset handle has been allocated for the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Width
element.short: The width of the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Height
element.short: The height of the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.OnClose
element.short: Event handler signalled when the dialog is closed.

element.name: TCommonDialog.OnCanClose
element.short: Event handler signalled to determine if the dialog can be closed.

element.name: TCommonDialog.OnShow
element.short: Event handler signalled when the dialog is displayed.

element.name: TCommonDialog.HelpContext
element.short: Help context identifier for the help message displayed for the dialog.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Title
element.short: The Title or Caption displayed for the dialog.

descr.p: Title can be used to provide a usage context for the re-usable dialog. The default value for the property is provided by the DefaultTitle method, and assigned in the Create constructor.

element.name: TFileDialog
element.short: TFileDialog allows selection of a file from the current directory.

descr.p: TFileDialog allows selection of a file from the current directory. This is also the base class for the Open and Save (As) dialogs.

element.name: TFileDialog.GetFilterIndex
element.short: GetFilterIndex - returns the Index value for the filename filter.

element.name: TFileDialog.SetFileName
element.short: SetFileName - specifies the filename in the file dialog.

element.name: TFileDialog.SetFilter
element.short: SetFilter - specifies the Filter for use in filename searching.

element.name: TFileDialog.SetHistoryList
element.short: SetHistoryList - specifies a list of strings that have been used in searching.

element.name: TFileDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TFileDialog, and calls the inherited Create method. It allocates resources needed for the files and history, and initializes the filter index.

element.name: TFileDialog.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TFileDialog.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for TFileDialog, and frees file and history lists then calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TFileDialog.DoTypeChange
element.short: DoTypeChange - perform the code for the OnTypeChange event.

element.name: TFileDialog.Files
element.short: Stringlist which stores the names of the selected files.

element.name: TFileDialog.HistoryList
element.short: HistoryList - stringlist containing the names of files recently accessed.

element.name: TFileDialog.IntfFileTypeChanged
element.short: IntfFileTypeChanged - interface method for file type change.

element.name: TFileDialog.DefaultExt
element.short: Sets the default file extension for the file dialog box.

element.name: TFileDialog.FileName
element.short: String storing the name of the file chosen by the user as UTF8

descr.p: If you need the filename as system encoded, you can use UTF8ToSys from the unit FileUtil.

element.name: TFileDialog.Filter
element.short: A string which contains possible filename filters (e.g. .doc, .xmp, .pas etc).

descr.p: This is a string which contains the filters a user can choose from. The available filters and their description are separated by pipe symbols.
To set this property at run-time assign a value like:
An entry can contain multiple masks separated by semicolon, like:

element.name: TFileDialog.FilterIndex
element.short: This property sets which file filter is the default.

descr.p: This property sets which file filter is the default. For example, set this property to 2 to set the second filter as default.

element.name: TFileDialog.InitialDir
element.short: Set the directory the dialog shows on opening.

element.name: TFileDialog.OnHelpClicked
element.short: Event handler when the Help button is clicked.

element.name: TFileDialog.OnTypeChange
element.short: Event Handler when the selected file type is changed.

element.name: TOpenOption
element.short: Options which can be used in OpenDialog.

descr.p: TOpenOption contains a list of possible options which can be used in an Open dialog.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofOverwritePrompt
element.short: If selected file exists shows a message, that file will be overwritten.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofHideReadOnly
element.short: hide read only file.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofNoChangeDir
element.short: do not change current directory.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofShowHelp
element.short: show a help button.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofAllowMultiSelect
element.short: allow multiselection.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofPathMustExist
element.short: shows an error message if selected path does not exist.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofFileMustExist
element.short: shows an error message if selected file does not exist.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofNoReadOnlyReturn
element.short: do not return filenames that are readonly.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofNoDereferenceLinks
element.short: do not resolve links while dialog is shown (only on Windows, see OFN_NODEREFERENCELINKS).

element.name: TOpenOption.ofNoResolveLinks
element.short: do not resolve links after Execute.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofEnableSizing
element.short: dialog can be resized, e.g. via the mouse.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofDontAddToRecent
element.short: do not add the path to the history list.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofForceShowHidden
element.short: show hidden files.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofViewDetail
element.short: details are OS and interface dependent.

element.name: TOpenOption.ofAutoPreview
element.short: OS and interface dependent.

element.name: TOpenOptions
element.short: Set used to store TOpenOption enumeration values.

element.name: DefaultOpenDialogOptions
element.short: Set constant with the default Open Dialog options.

element.name: TOpenDialog
element.short: Opens a file in the current directory, selected by File Dialog.

descr.p: TOpenDialog opens a file in the current directory, selected by File Dialog. If the required file is not in the current directory, another directory can be selected with SelectDirectory.

element.name: TOpenDialog.ResolveLinks
element.short: Gets physical file names for file references or symbolic links.

descr.p: ResolveLinks is a procedure used to get physical file names for file references or symbolic links used in the Filename and Files properties.
Called from DereferenceLinks when the dialog is executed and ofNoResolveLinks is NOT included in the Options property.

element.name: TOpenDialog.DereferenceLinks
element.short: Resolves referential links.

descr.p: Deprecated since LCL version 1.9. Use or override ResolveLinks instead.

element.name: TOpenDialog.CheckFile
element.short: Determines if the specified file name meets the requirements for the dialog.

element.name: TOpenDialog.CheckFileMustExist
element.short: CheckFileMustExist returns True if a file with the specified name exists.

element.name: TOpenDialog.CheckAllFiles
element.short: Calls CheckFile for each selected file, returns True if all are OK.

element.name: TOpenDialog.DefaultTitle
element.short: Gets the default title used for the Open Dialog.

descr.p: DefaultTitle is overridden in TOpenDialog to return the default title for the dialog. Uses the value in rsfdOpenFile as the return value.
Used in the inherited constructor to set the default value for the Title property.

element.name: TOpenDialog.DefaultTitle.Result
element.short: Default title for the dialog.

element.name: TOpenDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TOpenDialog, and calls the inherited Create method then loads the default options for the dialog.

element.name: TOpenDialog.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TOpenDialog.DoFolderChange
element.short: DoFolderChange - execute the code for a folder change.

element.name: TOpenDialog.DoSelectionChange
element.short: DoSelectionChange - execute the code for a change in selection.

element.name: TOpenDialog.Options
element.short: Options to be used for this dialog.

descr.p: Options to be used for the Open File dialog. A full list of available options is found in .

element.name: TOpenDialog.OnFolderChange
element.short: Event triggered when the user changes the folder in the OpenDialog.

descr.p: This event is called when the user changes the folder (directory) in the OpenDialog.
Note: changing the folder will also trigger the OnSelectionChange event.

element.name: TOpenDialog.OnSelectionChange
element.short: Event triggered when the user changes the selection made in the OpenDialog.

descr.p: This event is triggered when the user changes the selected file in the OpenDialog.
Note: When the user changes the folder OnSelectionChange will be called first.

element.name: TSaveDialog
element.short: TSaveDialog - Dialog for saving the current buffer to a file.

descr.p: Save Dialog: invoked when the application requires to save a file.

If the file is already open or a filename has been specified, then the current buffer is written to that file. If no file is specified, the Save File As dialog is invoked and the buffer is saved to that file.

element.name: TSaveDialog.DefaultTitle.Result
element.short: Default title for the dialog.

element.name: TSaveDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Create update the component style flags to the value used for the dialog type.

element.name: TSaveDialog.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TSelectDirectoryDialog
element.short: Select Directory Dialog.

descr.p: SelectDirectoryDialog allows the user to select a directory when the directory structure is displayed as a tree.

element.name: TColorDialog
element.short: TColorDialog - dialog for selecting a color to use in graphics and text.

descr.p: TColorDialog presents a palette of colors to allow the user to select the required color for text or graphics.
Call the Execute method to display the color dialog.

element.name: TColorDialog.FColor
element.short: Internal member used to store the value for he selected color.

element.name: TColorDialog.FCustomColors
element.short: Internal member used to store user-specified colors.

element.name: TColorDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TColorDialog, and calls the inherited Create method. Create allocates resources and initializes the Color and CustomColors properties.

element.name: TColorDialog.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TColorDialog.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for TColorDialog, and frees custom colors then calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TColorDialog.Title
element.short: The Title or Caption displayed in the title bar for the dialog.

descr.p: Title can be used to provide a usage context for the re-usable dialog. The default value for the property is provided by the DefaultTitle method, which is an empty string in TColorDialog. Set the value for the property before calling the Execute method.

element.name: TColorDialog.Color
element.short: Color selected by the user in the color dialog.

descr.p: Color is a TColor property with the color selected using the dialog. A value can be pre-set and may be accepted, but a new value may also be chosen. When the Color dialog is displayed and the user pressed OK, the Color property contains the chosen color.
Use CustomColors to define a palette with color names and their hexadecimal values available in the dialog.

element.name: TColorDialog.CustomColors
element.short: Defines the color names and values available in the color dialog.

descr.p: CustomColors is a TStrings property which contains the color names and hexadecimal values available in the color dialog. It allows a custom color palette to be used in place of the default colors for the platform.
Values added to CustomColors are in the "name=hexvalue" format. For example:
The hexadecimal color value is 6-digits representing the RGB components for the color.
The default values in CustomColors are assigned in the Create constructor to the standard and extended colors for the platform. It does not include the equivalents for clDefault and clNone.
Use Color to get the TColor value selected using the dialog when the Execute method was called.

element.name: TColorButton
element.short: TColorButton - a SpeedButton designed to be used with the Color dialog, allowing a color to be selected for text or graphics.

descr.p: TColorButton - a SpeedButton designed to be used with the Color dialog, allowing a color to be selected for text or graphics.

To use the ColorButton, first select the ColorButton icon from the Component Palette and place it on the Form Designer in the location you want it to occupy, then place a TColorDialog on the Form Designer, give it a name (or accept the default name) and select this named dialog as the ColorDialog property in the Object Inspector for the ColorButton.

The default appearance of the ColorButton is a rectangle containing a color; if you wish to include a caption beside the block of color, you may need to adjust the size of the control to accommodate the text, and you can then enter some text in the Caption property of the ColorButton; this text will appear next to the color block.

At run-time the ColorButton is visible with a default or preselected ButtonColor in the block, and any optional caption beside it; the ColorDialog is not visible until the ColorButton is clicked, when the ColorDialog pops up and offers a choice of colors, either from a list or a palette, and if the user makes a selection and closes the dialog by pressing OK, the ColorButton will display the color that was chosen in the ColorDialog.

Note that in the context of ColorButton, properties with the name ButtonColor refer to the color that has been selected and is displayed in the color block; properties entitled Color without 'Button' attached refer to the color of the control itself, usually the same as the background or the default button face color.

element.name: TColorButton.DrawGlyph
element.short: DrawGlyph - draw the glyph on the button face.

element.name: TColorButton.GetDisabledPattern
element.short: GetDisabledPattern returns a BitMap with a disabled pattern.

element.name: TColorButton.GetGlyphSize
element.short: GetGlyphSize returns a value with the size for glyphs on the button.

element.name: TColorButton.ShowColorDialog
element.short: Displays a Color dialog and captures its result.

descr.p: ShowColorDialog is a method used to display a TColorDialog and capture its result.

ShowColorDialog uses an existing dialog instance in ColorDialog when assigned. Otherwise, a new TColorDialog instance is created and temporarily stored in the property. The value in ButtonColor is used as the default color value in the dialog. The Execute method in the dialog is called to get the selected Color value, and it is stored in the ButtonColor property.

element.name: TColorButton.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TColorButton, and calls the inherited Create method. Create sets initial bounds for the controls, as well as its size and pattern.

element.name: TColorButton.Create.AnOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TColorButton.BorderWidth
element.short: Width for the borders on the button.

element.name: TColorButton.ButtonColorAutoSize
element.short: True if the button can be automatically re-sized.

descr.p: ButtonColorAutoSize is a Boolean property which indicates if the button can be automatically re-sized.

element.name: TColorButton.ButtonColorSize
element.short: ButtonColorSize - the size of the button color block.

element.name: TColorButton.ButtonColor
element.short: ButtonColor - the color that has been selected by the ColorDialog and is displayed in the button.

element.name: TColorButton.ColorDialog
element.short: The ColorDialog that opens when the button is activated.

element.name: TColorButton.Caption
element.short: Caption - a string that can be placed beside the block of color.

element.name: TColorButton.Color
element.short: The Color of the control itself, i.e. the parts that are not the color display block; edges, background etc.

element.name: TColorButton.OnColorChanged
element.short: OnColorChanged - event handler for a change in button color.

element.name: TFontDialogOption
element.short: An enumerated list of constants to set the options of a Font dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdAnsiOnly
element.short: Limits the font name selection list to font using ANSI character sets.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdTrueTypeOnly
element.short: Limits the font name selection list to TrueType fonts.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdEffects
element.short: Displays check boxes for strikethrough, underline, et. al. font effects in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdFixedPitchOnly
element.short: Limits the font name selection list to fixed-pitch (mono-spaced) fonts.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdNoFaceSel
element.short: Hides the font name selection list in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdNoOEMFonts
element.short: Excludes OEM fonts from the font selection list.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdNoSimulations
element.short: Excludes bitmapped fonts that emulate sizes by scaling.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdNoSizeSel
element.short: Hides the Size selection list in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdNoStyleSel
element.short: Hides the style selection list in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdNoVectorFonts
element.short: Excludes vector fonts from the list of font names.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdShowHelp
element.short: Makes the Help button visible in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdWysiwyg
element.short: Displays font names using a WYSIWYG preview.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdLimitSize
element.short: Restricts font sizes to the range in MinFontSize and MaxFontSize.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdScalableOnly
element.short: Limits the font selection list to scalable fonts; no bitmapped fonts.

element.name: TFontDialogOption.fdApplyButton
element.short: Makes the Apply button visible in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOptions
element.short: Set type used to store font dialog options.

element.name: TFontDialog
element.short: Dialog used to select a font typeface and size.

descr.p: TFontDialog is a TCommonDialog descendant which implements a font selection dialog.

TFontDialog displays selection lists for font name, size, style, and color. It can be configured to limit the available typefaces, sizes, and visual presentations using the Options, MinFontSize and MaxFontSize properties.

When the dialog is executed, the selected font is made available in the Font property. The OnApplyClicked event handler can be used to perform actions needed when the optional Apply button is clicked in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialog.SetFont
element.short: Sets the value for the Font property.

element.name: TFontDialog.SetFont.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TFontDialog.ApplyClicked
element.short: Performs actions needed when a font is selected using the dialog.

descr.p: ApplyClicked is a used to perform actions needed when a font is applied using the Apply button in the dialog. The Apply button is made visible by a setting in Options, and must be enabled; the default buttons are Ok and Cancel.
ApplyClicked signals the OnApplyClicked event handler (when assigned).
descr.remark: Widgetset classes in the current LCL implementaion do not call ApplyClicked; they signal the OnApplyClicked event handler directly.

element.name: TFontDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Create allocates resources needed for the Font property, and sets the default values in the Options property.

element.name: TFontDialog.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TFontDialog.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TFontDialog.Font
element.short: Contains the Font selected in the dialog.

descr.p: Font is a TFont property with the font selected using the dialog. The value in Font is updated in widgetset classes when the OK or Apply button is clicked during execution of the dialog.
Use the OnApplyClicked event handler to perform actions needed when the Apply button is enabled and clicked in the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialog.MinFontSize
element.short: Minimum font size allowed in the font selection dialog.

descr.p: MinFontSize is an Integer property which contains the minimum font size allowed in the font selection dialog. Limiting font size selection to the range in MinFontSize and MaxFontSize must be enabled using the Options property.

element.name: TFontDialog.MaxFontSize
element.short: Maximum font size allowed in the font selection dialog.

descr.p: MaxFontSize is an Integer property which contains the maximum font size allowed in the font selection dialog. Limiting font size selection to the range in MinFontSize and MaxFontSize must be enabled using the Options property.

element.name: TFontDialog.Options
element.short: A set of options available from TFontDialogOptions.

descr.p: Options is a TFontDialogOptions property which controls the options enabled for the font selection dialog. Options contains zero or more values from the TFontDialogOption enumeration. The default value for the property is [fdEffects], and enables the font effects check boxes in the dialog.
See TFontDialogOption for more information about the values in the enumeration and their usage.
Set (or Include and Exclude) values in the property prior to calling the Execute method.

element.name: TFontDialog.OnApplyClicked
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Apply button is clicked in the font dialogs.

descr.p: OnApplyClicked is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the Apply button is clicked in the font dialog. The Apply button must be enabled in the Options property to receive the event notification.

OnApplyClicked allows the application to perform actions needed when a Font has been applied. This can include assigning the value in Font to another control. SImilar actions need to be performed when the Execute method returns True, indicating that the OK button was clicked.
OnApplyClicked is signalled from the ApplyClicked method, and triggered directly from methods in widgetset classes.

element.name: TFontDialog.PreviewText
element.short: A text snippet displayed as a preview for the selected font in the dialog.

descr.p: PreviewText is a String property with a short snippet of text to display using the currently selected font in the dialog. It acts as a WYSIWYG preview mechanism.

Please note that use of PreviewText is dependent on platform / widgetset support. For instance, Windows does render PreviewText. It uses its own "Sample", and renders the font name in the selection list using the typeface. QT and QT5 have the same behavior as Windows. It is implemented for the GTK, GTK2 and MUI widgetsets.

element.name: TFindOption
element.short: A list of possible options which can be used in Find-dialogs.
element.descr: A list of possible options which can be used in Find-dialogs.

element.name: TFindOption.frDown
element.short: If set the "Down" radiobutton is selected.

element.name: TFindOption.frFindNext
element.short: This option will be set when the user presses "Find Next"

element.name: TFindOption.frHideMatchCase
element.short: If set the "Match case" checkbox is hidden from the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindOption.frHideWholeWord
element.short: If set the "Whole word" checkbox is hidden from the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindOption.frHideUpDown
element.short: If set the "Up" and "Down" radiobuttons are hidden from the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindOption.frMatchCase
element.short: This flag is set when the user checks the "Match case" checkbox.

element.name: TFindOption.frDisableMatchCase
element.short: If set the "Match case" checkbox is disabled in the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindOption.frDisableUpDown
element.short: If set the "Up" and "Down" radiobuttons are disabled in the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindOption.frDisableWholeWord
element.short: If set the "Whole word" checkbox is disabled in the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindOption.frReplace
element.short: This flag is set if only the first occurrence of the search string is to be replaced with the replace string.

element.name: TFindOption.frReplaceAll
element.short: This flag is set if all occurrences of the search string are to be replaced with the replace string.

element.name: TFindOption.frWholeWord
element.short: This flag is set when the user checks the "Whole word" checkbox.

element.name: TFindOption.frShowHelp
element.short: If set the dialog will display a help button.

element.name: TFindOption.frPromptOnReplace
element.short: This flag is set when the user checks the "Prompt on replace" checkbox.

element.name: TFindOption.frHidePromptOnReplace
element.short: If set the "Prompt on replace" checkbox is hidden from the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindOptions
element.short: A set of TFindOption.

element.name: TFindDialog
element.short: TFindDialog - a dialog used for finding text within the current editor or text buffer.

descr.p: Opens a dialog box allowing the user to enter text for searching, for example in a text editor.

As TFindDialog is the parent class for the TReplaceDialog, it contains definitions for the Replace method, but the Replace option does not actually appear when the dialog is displayed: you need to use TReplaceDialog to do that.

element.name: TFindDialog.FFindForm
element.short: FFindForm - local variable holding the form used for the Find dialog.

element.name: TFindDialog.FOnReplace
element.short: FOnReplace - local variable identifying the event handler for replacing.

element.name: TFindDialog.FOnFind
element.short: FOnFind - local variable identifying the event handler for finding.

element.name: TFindDialog.FOptions
element.short: FOptions - local variable holding the set of current options.

element.name: TFindDialog.FOnHelpClicked
element.short: FOnHelpClicked - local variable identifying the help event handler.

element.name: TFindDialog.FReplaceText
element.short: FReplaceText - local variable holding the Replace text.

element.name: TFindDialog.FFindText
element.short: FFindText - local variable containing the text to be found.

element.name: TFindDialog.FindClick
element.short: FindClick - method for execution when the Find button is clicked.

element.name: TFindDialog.HelpClick
element.short: HelpClick - method to execute when the Help button is clicked.

element.name: TFindDialog.CancelClick
element.short: CancelClick - method to execute when the Cancel button is clicked.

element.name: TFindDialog.DoCloseForm
element.short: DoCloseForm - execute the code for closing the Find/Replace dialog form.

element.name: TFindDialog.Find
element.short: Find - software emulation of the OnFind event.

element.name: TFindDialog.Help
element.short: Help - software emulation of the OnHelpClicked event.

element.name: TFindDialog.Replace
element.short: Replace - software emulation of the OnReplace event.

element.name: TFindDialog.CreateForm
element.short: CreateForm - function result returns the form that was created.

element.name: TFindDialog.SetFormValues
element.short: SetFormValues - specifies the values for the form.

element.name: TFindDialog.GetFormValues
element.short: GetFormValues - finds the values for the form.

element.name: TFindDialog.ReplaceText
element.short: ReplaceText - the text string that is to be substituted for the Find text.

element.name: TFindDialog.OnReplace
element.short: OnReplace - event handler for replacing text.

element.name: TFindDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TFindDialog, and calls the inherited Create method. It sets the initial option values for Find only.

element.name: TFindDialog.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TFindDialog.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TFindDialog.CloseDialog
element.short: CloseDialog and returns its resources.

element.name: TFindDialog.Execute.Result
element.short: True if the dialog was successfully completed.

element.name: TFindDialog.Left
element.short: The Left side of the dialog display.

element.name: TFindDialog.Position
element.short: The Position of the dialog display.

element.name: TFindDialog.Top
element.short: the Top of the dialog display.

element.name: TFindDialog.FindText
element.short: FindText - the text string that the dialog will try to find.

element.name: TFindDialog.Options
element.short: The current Options for the seeking and replacing process.

element.name: TFindDialog.OnFind
element.short: OnFind - event handler for a click on the Find button.

element.name: TFindDialog.OnHelpClicked
element.short: OnHelpClicked - event handler for a click on the Help button.

element.name: TReplaceDialog
element.short: A dialog allowing the user to replace text.

descr.p: The dialog appears and offers boxes for the user to enter text for searching and text to replace it, for example while editing a file or large piece of text.
A number of buttons appear, offering the choice to replace this instance, find next, replace all.

element.name: TReplaceDialog.ReplaceClick
element.short: ReplaceClick - code to execute when the Replace button is clicked (replace just the current instance).

element.name: TReplaceDialog.ReplaceAllClick
element.short: ReplaceAllClick - code to execute when the Replace All button is clicked (replace all remaining instances).

element.name: TReplaceDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TReplaceDialog, and calls the inherited Create method. It sets the initial option values for find and replace.

element.name: TReplaceDialog.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomPrinterSetupDialog
element.short: Base class for TPrinterSetupDialog and TPageSetupDialog.

element.name: TPrintRange
element.short: Enumerated type which represents page ranges in a print dialog.

element.name: TPrintRange.prAllPages
element.short: Print all pages.

element.name: TPrintRange.prSelection
element.short: Print the selected range of pages.

element.name: TPrintRange.prPageNums
element.short: Print the selection of individual pages.

element.name: TPrintRange.prCurrentPage
element.short: Print the current page.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption
element.short: Enumerated type with available options for a print dialog.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption.poPrintToFile
element.short: Enables and checks the print to a file check box.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption.poPageNums
element.short: Selects the Pages radio button in the dialog.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption.poSelection
element.short: Selects the Selection radio button in a print dialog.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption.poWarning
element.short: Displays a warning message for a print error.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption.poHelp
element.short: Displays a Help button in a print dialog.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption.poDisablePrintToFile
element.short: Disables the print to file check box in a print dialog.

element.name: TPrintDialogOptions
element.short: A set for options in a print dialog.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog
element.short: TCustomPrintDialog - base class for TPrintDialog.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.Collate
element.short: Enables page collation when multiple copies are produced.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.Copies
element.short: Number of Copies of the document.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.FromPage
element.short: FromPage - first page of selection for printing.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.MinPage
element.short: MinPage - smallest number of page in print range.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.MaxPage
element.short: MaxPage - highest number of page in print range.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.Options
element.short: The set of Options for printing.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.PrintToFile
element.short: When True, printing is spooled to a file instead of the printer.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.PrintRange
element.short: PrintRange - the range of pages for printing.

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog.ToPage
element.short: ToPage - the final page number in the range for printing.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag
element.short: Represents options that can be enabled for TTaskDialog.
element.descr: TTaskDialogFlag values are stored in the TTaskDialogFlags type, as used in the TCustomTaskDialog.Flags property.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfEnableHyperlinks
element.short: Allows HTML-like hyperlinks in the dialog (in Text, Footer, and ExpandedText) using the 'Target' notation.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfUseHiconMain
element.short: Uses the handle to the image in MainIcon as the primary image for the Task dialog. Disables hyperlinks.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfUseHiconFooter
element.short: Uses the handle to the image in FooterIcon as the footer icon in the Task dialog. Disables hyperlinks.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfAllowDialogCancellation
element.short: Allow canceling the dialog by Esc key, or Alt+F4 (i.e. OS default hotkey).

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfUseCommandLinks
element.short: Custom buttons will be shown as big buttons in the middle of the dialog. Use #10 to add info to buttons (shown in hint in emulated dialog). Disables hyperlinks.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfUseCommandLinksNoIcon
element.short: Hides glyphs for custom buttons in the "command links" mode. Disables hyperlinks.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfExpandFooterArea
element.short: Show ExpandedText in the footer, instead of inline after the main text.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfExpandedByDefault
element.short: Displays the dialog with ExpandedText in the expanded state.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfVerificationFlagChecked
element.short: Displays the verification check-box verification shows in the checked state.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfShowProgressBar
element.short: Shows a progress bar.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfShowMarqueeProgressBar
element.short: Shows a progress bar using the marquee style.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfCallbackTimer
element.short: Execute the timer callback event every 200 milliseconds.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfPositionRelativeToWindow
element.short: Form position will be poOwnerFormCenter, instead of poScreenCenter.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfRtlLayout
element.short: Use Right-to-Left layout for texts.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfNoDefaultRadioButton
element.short: Does not pre-select any of the radio buttons.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlag.tfCanBeMinimized
element.short: Allow the dialog to be minimized.

element.name: TTaskDialogFlags
element.short: Set type used to store values from the TTaskDialogFlag enumeration.

descr.p: TTaskDialogFlags is the type used for the TCustomTaskDialog.Flags property.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButton
element.short: Identifier used for common buttons visible on a Task dialog.

descr.p: Values from TTaskDialogCommonButton are stored in the TTaskDialogCommonButtons set type, as used in the TCustomTaskDialog.CommonButtons property. When a value is included in the set, the corresponding button is visible on the task dialog.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButton.tcbOk
element.short: The Ok button.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButton.tcbYes
element.short: The Yes button.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButton.tcbNo
element.short: The No button.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButton.tcbCancel
element.short: The Cancel button.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButton.tcbRetry
element.short: The Retry button.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButton.tcbClose
element.short: The Close button.

element.name: TTaskDialogCommonButtons
element.short: Set type used to store values from TTaskDialogCommonButton.

descr.p: TTaskDialogCommonButtons is the type used for the CommonButtons property in TCustomTaskDialog.

element.name: TTaskDlgClickEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a button is clicked in TCustomTaskDialog / TTaskDialog.

descr.p: TTaskDlgClickEvent is the type used for the OnButtonClicked event handler in TCustomTaskDialog.

element.name: TTaskDlgClickEvent.Sender
element.short: Task dialog for the event notification.

element.name: TTaskDlgClickEvent.AModalResult
element.short: Modal result for the clicked button.

element.name: TTaskDlgClickEvent.ACanClose
element.short: True if the dialog can close.

element.name: TTaskDialogIcon
element.short: Identifier for an icon displayed on a Task dialog.

descr.p: TTaskDialogIcon is the type used for the FooterIcon and MainIcon properties in TCustomTaskDialog.

element.name: TTaskDialogIcon.tdiNone
element.short: No icon is displayed.

element.name: TTaskDialogIcon.tdiWarning
element.short: Displays the Warning icon (Amber triangle with an Exclamation mark).

element.name: TTaskDialogIcon.tdiError
element.short: Displays the Error icon (Red circle with an X).

element.name: TTaskDialogIcon.tdiInformation
element.short: Displays the Information icon (Blue circle with a Question Mark).

element.name: TTaskDialogIcon.tdiShield
element.short: Displays the Shield icon.

element.name: TTaskDialogIcon.tdiQuestion
element.short: Displays the Question icon (Blue circle with a Question Mark).

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem
element.short: Defines the base class for a custom button displayed on a Task dialog.

descr.p: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem is a TCollectionItem descendant which defines a custom button that can be displayed on a Task dialog. It provides properties that indicate the Caption for the button, its use as the Default button on a dialog, and its ModalResult value.
TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem is the ancestor for TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.Client
element.short: TCustomTaskDialog where the button is used.

descr.p: Client is a read-only TCustomTaskDialog property with the dialog where the button is used. Its value is set to the Task dialog that is the owner of the collection where the button definition is stored.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.GetDisplayName
element.short: Gets the value for the DisplayName property.

descr.p: GetDisplayName is an overridden method used to get the value for the DisplayName property. In TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem, the value in Caption is used (when assigned) for the property value. When Caption is empty, the inherited method is called to get the property value.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.GetDisplayName.Result
element.short: Value for the DisplayName property.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.TaskButtonCollection
element.short: Gets the collection where the button definition is stored.

descr.p: TaskButtonCollection is a TTaskDialogButtons function which retrieves the Collection where the button definition is stored. It allows the button definition to access properties and methods in the collection.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.TaskButtonCollection.Result
element.short: Collection which owns the button cast to a TTaskDialogButtons type.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. It calls the inherited method on entry, and sets the value in the Client property to the dialog which is the owner for the Collection. The value in ModalResult is set to the ID value for the collection item + 100.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the button item.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.ModalResult
element.short: Modal result value returned when the button is clicked.

descr.p: The default value for the property is assigned when the button item is created and is based in its ID value + 100. The value can be changed to any reasonable value that is unique for the context.
ModalResult is used when a Task dialog is executed and a button is clicked on the dialog. Its value for the clicked button is assigned to the ModalResult property in the TCustomTaskDialog instance.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.Caption
element.short: Caption text displayed on the button surface.

descr.p: Caption is a TTranslateString property with the caption text displayed on the button surface. It can be localized using the built-in translation facilities available in the LCL. When assigned, Caption also provides the DisplayName for the collection item in the object inspector.

element.name: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem.Default
element.short: Indicates if the button is the default button on a Task dialog.

descr.p: Default is a Boolean property which indicates if the button is the default button for a Task dialog. The default value for the property is False.

Changing the value in the property causes the DefaultButton property in the Collection to be updated. When set to True, the button instance is assigned to the DefaultButton property in the collection. When set to False, the DefaultButton in the collection is set to Nil.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonItem
element.short: Implements a button definition used for a button in TCustomTaskDialog.

descr.p: TTaskDialogButtonItem is a TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem descendant used to define and store buttons created in TCustomTaskDialog / TTaskDialog. It provides an overridden constructor which creates an object inspector-friendly name for the button item. It also sets the visibility for the ModalResult property to published.
TTaskDialogButtonItem is the type used for the Button property in TCustomTaskDialog, and maintained in its Buttons collection.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonItem.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. It assigns an object inspector-friendly value to the Caption property, such as 'Button3'. The Caption is also used as the DisplayName for the collection item when assigned.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonItem.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the button item.

element.name: TTaskDialogRadioButtonItem
element.short: Implements a radio button displayed on a Task dialog.

descr.p: TTaskDialogRadioButtonItem is a TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem descendant which implements a radio button displayed on a Task dialog. TTaskDialogRadioButtonItem is the type used for the RadioButton property in TCustomTaskDialog, and maintained in its RadioButtons collection.

element.name: TTaskDialogRadioButtonItem.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. Creates assign an object inspector-friendly value for the Caption property, such as 'RadioButton2'.

element.name: TTaskDialogRadioButtonItem.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the radio button item.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator
element.short: Implements an enumerator for buttons defined in a Task dialog.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Sets the internal position for the enumerator to -1 to indicate that a button is not available. Use MoveNext to position the enumerator at the first button in the collection.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the buttons for the enumerator.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator.GetCurrent
element.short: Gets the value for the Current property.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator.GetCurrent.Result
element.short: Value for the Current property.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator.MoveNext
element.short: Positions the enumerator on the next button in the collection.

descr.p: MoveNext is a Boolean function used to move the position for the enumeration to the next button in the collection. When the enumerator is created, its position is undefined (-1) by default. Use MoveNext to move the position to the first button when the enumerator is created.
The return value is True when another value was found in the collection. It is set to False if the position reaches the value in Count.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator.MoveNext.Result
element.short: True if another button was available in the collection.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator.Current
element.short: Button at the current position for the enumerator.

descr.p: Current is a read-only TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem property with the button at the current position for the enumerator. It uses the ordinal position in the collection for the button item as set when the MoveNext method was called.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons
element.short: Collection type used to access and maintain buttons defined for a Task dialog.

descr.p: TTaskDialogButtons is a TOwnedCollection descendant which implements the collection used for the buttons on a Task dialog. TTaskDialogButtons provides properties and methods used to access and maintain the buttons in the collection, such as: Add, FindButton, DefaultButton, Items, and GetEnumerator.
TTaskDialogButtons is the type used for the Buttons and RadioButtons properties in TCustomTaskDialog / TTaskDialog.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.Add
element.short: Adds a new collection item using the ItemClass for the collection.

descr.p: Calls the inherited Add method to create the new collection item, and casts the return value to the TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem type used as the ItemClass. The inherited method uses the Collection as the Owner for the new collection item.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.Add.Result
element.short: Collection item created in the method.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.FindButton
element.short: Gets the button item in the collection with the specified modal result value.

descr.p: FindButton enumerates values in the Items property to find the first button using the modal result value in AModalResult. The return value is Nil if a button using the modal result value is not found.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.FindButton.Result
element.short: TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem instance with the specified modal result value.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.FindButton.AModalResult
element.short: Modal result value to locate in the button items for the collection.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.GetEnumerator
element.short: Gets an enumerator for the buttons in the Items property.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.GetEnumerator.Result
element.short: TTaskDialogButtonsEnumerator instance for the buttons in the collection.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.DefaultButton
element.short: Contains the collection item that is the default button for a Task dialog.

descr.p: DefaultButton is a TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem property with the button that is the default button for a Task dialog. The value for the property is updated when the Default property in a button item is changed.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to buttons defined in the collection.

descr.p: Items is an indexed TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem property with the buttons defined for the collection. It re-implements the property introduced in the ancestor class to use the TTaskDialogBaseButtonItem type when reading or writing values in the collection. Values in the property are accessed by their ordinal position in the collection.
Items is the default property, and the target for an enumerator created for the class instance.

element.name: TTaskDialogButtons.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection for the property value.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog
element.short: Defines a configurable, modal task dialog at run-time.

descr.p: TCustomTaskDialog is a TComponent descendant which defines a configurable, modal task dialog. It is a non-visual component which creates modal dialogs at run-time, with rich UI elements. It is a wrapper for LCLTaskDialog.TTaskDialog which implements the Windows TaskDialog API.

TCustomTaskDialog provides properties which can be used to configure the class instance at design-time in the object inspector. At run-time, the Execute method handles converting properties and calling routines in the LCLTaskDialog.TTaskDialog implementation.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.DoExecute
element.short: Performs actions to convert values in the class, and execute the dialog using the wrapper in the LCLTaskDialog unit.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.DoExecute.Result
element.short: True if a valid button identifier was clicked in the dialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.DoExecute.ParentWnd
element.short: Handle for the Parent Window of the dialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.DoOnButtonClicked
element.short: Signals the OnButtonClicked event handler (when assigned) for the button with the specified modal result value.

descr.p: DoOnButtonClicked is called from the callback routine passed to the wrapper in LCLTaskDialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.DoOnButtonClicked.AModalResult
element.short: Modal result value signalled for the button click notification.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.DoOnButtonClicked.ACanClose
element.short: True if the dialog should be closed, or False to continue execution.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. Create allocates resources needed for the Buttons and RadioButtons properties. It sets the default values for the following properties:

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It frees resources allocated for the Buttons and RadioButtons properties, and calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Execute
element.short: Displays the dialog and captures the modal result value.

descr.p: Execute is an overloaded Boolean function used to display the dialog and capture the modal result value using the wrapper in the LCLTaskDialog unit. The return value is True if a valid button identifier was selected in the wrapper.

Execute calls the DoExecute method to convert property values in the class instance to the values expected in the TTaskDialog record, and execute the dialog using the LCLTaskDialog wrapper. The value in ModalResult is updated from the Button with the identifier returned from the wrapper.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Execute.Result
element.short: True if a valid button identifier was selected in the dialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Execute.ParentWnd
element.short: Parent window handle used to position the dialog in the LCLTaskDialog wrapper.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Button
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

descr.p: Button is a TTaskDialogButtonItem property. It is not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Buttons
element.short: Collection with the buttons for the Task dialog.

descr.p: Buttons is a TTaskDialogButtons property with the collection that contains the buttons for the Task dialog. Values in Buttons and CommonButtons are used in the DoExecute method to define the button identifiers and modal result values available in the LCLTaskDialog wrapper.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Caption
element.short: Caption text displayed on the title bar for the Task dialog.

descr.p: Caption is a TTranslateString property with the text displayed on the title bar for the Task dialog. Caption can be localized using the LCL translation facilities.

Use Title to set the text displayed as the title in the main content area. Use Text to set the text displayed beneath the Title in the main content area. Use ExpandedText to set the text displayed in the expandable content area for the dialog. Use FooterText to set the text displayed in the footer aread for the dialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.CommonButtons
element.short: Set of common buttons displayed on the Task dialog.

descr.p: CommonButtonsis a TTaskDialogCommonButtons property with the set of common buttons displayed on the Task dialog. Values from the TTaskDialogCommonButton enumeration are included in the set to make buttons visible. Values are excluded from the set to remove the buttons. The default value for the property is [tcbOk, tcbCancel], and enables the OK and Cancel buttons for the Task dialog.

CommonButtons is used in conjunction with the Buttons collection, which contains custom button definitions that do not fit the common button definitions. Both CommonButtons and Buttons are used in DoExecute, and passed as arguments to the wrapper in LCLTaskDialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.DefaultButton
element.short: Index of the default button, from the set in the CommonButtons property.

descr.p: DefaultButton is TTaskDialogCommonButton property which indicates the default button for the Task dialog. It represents the button that is clicked if the user presses the Space or Enter key when the Task dialog is initially displayed.
The property contains one of the values from the CommonButtons property. The default value for the property is tcbOK, and represents the OK button.
It is used to set the default modal result value returned during execution when a DefaultButton has not been specified in the Buttons collection.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.ExpandButtonCaption
element.short: Caption displayed for the expand/collapse button on the dialog.

descr.p: ExpandButtonCaption is a TTranslateString property with the caption text displayed beside the button used to expand or collapse the ExpandedText on the Task dialog. The property value can be localized using the standard LCL translation facilities.

The default value for the property is an empty String (''), and cause the values "See details" or "Hide details" to be used on the Task dialog (when the lanuguage is English). Setting a value for the property causes the same caption to be displayed for both the expanded and collapsed states; only the button indicator changes.
Use the Flags property to control the position (tfExpandFooterArea) or the expanded / collapsed state (tfExpandedByDefault) for the ExpandedText on the Task dialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.ExpandedText
element.short: Text that is displayed in the expandable / collapsible area on the Task dialog.

descr.p: ExpandedText is a TTranslateString property with the text displayed in the expandable / collapsible area on the Task dialog. Its value can be localized using the standard LCL translation facilities. It can contain multi-line text when line ending characters (#13,#10) are embedded in the String value. For example:
descr.code: ADialog.ExpandedText := 'Please read the Terms of Service.'+#10+ 'Available on our Website';
descr.p: Or, the multi-line value can be entered in the object inspector property editor at design-time.

Text, ExpandedText, and FooterText allow an HTML-like hyperlinking capability (as seen in the previous code example). The feature must be enabled by including tfEnableHyperlinks in the Flags property. Use tfExpandFooterArea to control the position for the expanded text, or tfExpandedByDefault to expand or collapse the text area.

element.version: Multi-line property editors in the object inspector were enabled in Lazarus version 2.2.0.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Flags
element.short: Set of options enabled for the Task dialog.
element.descr: Flags is a TTaskDialogFlags property with the set of options for the Task dialog. It contains values from the TTaskDialogFlag enumeration, and when included, enable the corresponding feature in the Task Dialog. The default value for the property is [tfAllowDialogCancellation] and allows the dialog to be cancelled.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.FooterIcon
element.short: Icon for the footer area displayed at the bottom of the dialog.

descr.p: FooterIcon is a TTaskDialogIcon property with a value which identifies the icon displayed in the footer area for the Task dialog. The footer icon is displayed beside the optional text in FooterText. The default value for the property is tdiNone, and causes the icon to be omitted. See TTaskDialogIcon for information about the values in the enumeration and their meanings.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.FooterText
element.short: Text that is displayed in the footer area on the Task dialog.

descr.p: FooterText is a TTranslateString property with the text displayed in the footer area on the Task dialog. Its value can be localized using the standard LCL translation facilities. It can contain multi-line text when line ending characters (#13,#10) are embedded in the String value. For example:
descr.code: ADialog.FooterText := '(c) Copyright 1960-2021, Acme Corporation LLC.' + #10 + 'All rights reserved.';
descr.p: Or, the multi-line value can be entered in the object inspector property editor at design-time.

Text, ExpandedText, and FooterText allow an HTML-like hyperlinking capability using the Link Text notation. The feature must be enabled by including tfEnableHyperlinks in the Flags property. Use tfExpandFooterArea to position the expanded text in the footer area.

element.version: Multi-line property editors in the object inspector were enabled in Lazarus version 2.2.0.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.MainIcon
element.short: Icon displayed beside the Title for the dialog.

descr.p: MainIcon is a TTaskDialogIcon with a value that identifies the icon displayed beside the Title for the Task dialog. The default value is tdiInformation, and causes a blue circle with a Question Mark to be displayed as the icon. See TTaskDialogIcon for more information about the values in the enumeration and their meanings.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.ModalResult
element.short: Modal result value returned when the Task dialog was executed.

descr.p: ModalResult is a TModalResult property with the modal result value returned when the Task dialog was executed. It contains the corresponding value from the Button used to close the Task dialog, DefaultButton if Enter or Space was pressed when the dialog was displayed, or mrNone if the dialog was cancelled.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.RadioButton
element.short: The radio button selected in the Task dialog.

descr.p: RadioButton is a read-only TTaskDialogRadioButtonItem property with the radio button selected when the Task dialog was executed. The property value is set when the Execute method calls the wrapper in LCLTaskDialog. It contains an entry from the RadioButtons collection that was passed as an argument to the TTaskDialog wrapper.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.RadioButtons
element.short: Collection with the optional radio buttons defined for the Task dialog.

descr.p: RadioButtons is a TTaskDialogButtons property with the collection of defined radio buttons for the Task dialog.

Radio buttons are displayed in the main content area for the Task dialog, below the values in Text and ExpandedText. Use of radio buttons is optional. They are displayed when items have been added to the collection. The TTaskDialogRadioButtonItem items in the collection are passed as an argument when the Execute method is called.
Use the RadioButton property to determine the radio button selected on the Task dialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Text
element.short: Text displayed as main content for the Task dialog.

descr.p: Text is a TTranslateString property with the text displayed in the main content area on the Task dialog. Its value can be localized using the standard LCL translation facilities. It can contain multi-line text when line ending characters (#13,#10) are embedded in the String value. For example:
descr.code: ADialog.Text := 'Please read and accept the Terms of Service. '+ #10+'You must agree before the application can be installed.';
descr.p: Or, the multi-line value can be entered in the object inspector property editor at design-time.

Text, ExpandedText, and FooterText allow an HTML-like hyperlinking capability using the Link Text notation. The feature must be enabled by including tfEnableHyperlinks in the Flags property. Use tfExpandFooterArea to position the expanded text in the footer area.
Use ExpandedText to set the content in the collapsible area on the Task dialog. Use tfExpandFooterArea in the FLags property to position the expanded text in the footer area.

element.version: Multi-line property editors in the object inspector were enabled in Lazarus version 2.2.0.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.Title
element.short: Header text displayed at the top of dialog, with a larger font size and using a bold font style.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.VerificationText
element.short: Optional caption text for the check box displayed at the bottom of the Task dialog.

element.name: TCustomTaskDialog.OnButtonClicked
element.short: Event handler signalled for the button clicked when the Task dialog was executed.

descr.p: OnButtonClicked is signalled after a button is clicked on the Task dialog.

element.name: TTaskDialog
element.short: Creates a configurable, modal task dialog at run-time.

descr.p: A non-visual component which creates modal dialogs at run-time, with rich UI elements. Like the Windows TaskDialog API. For example:

element.name: MinimumDialogButtonWidth
element.short: Minimum width for a button on a dialog.

element.name: MinimumDialogButtonHeight
element.short: Minimum height for a button on a dialog.

element.name: MessageDlg
element.short: Shows a message to the user and gets the response.

descr.p: There are four versions of this function.
The first version displays a dialog with the standard caption. The second, third and fourth versions enable you to set the caption.
The third version allows for a Default button;.
The fourth version contains a help keyword instead of using context-based help.
If the first Caption argument is missing, no caption is shown on the box.
This is the most complete and elaborate of the message dialogs, and allows the programmer considerable control over the appearance of the dialog box.
The arguments defining the kind of box and its icon are types rather than integer constants, and the buttons can be specified as a set in square brackets e.g. [mbRetry, mbIgnore, mbAbort, mbCancel].
The HelpCtx argument allows the use of Context Help
The return value from the Function is the identity of the button pressed, expressed as an integer (see the constant definitions in TControl , [mrNone..mrAll]).
If the user clicks the [X]-bordericon, the return value will be mrCancel.
If the user presses the escape key, the result depends on the widgetset:

ul.li: If the widgetset has implemented a native dialog, the result will be mrCancel.

Otherwise the result will be mrCancel, mrNo or mrOk (in that order) when mbCancel, mbNo or mbOk is present. The dialog will not close when the Escape key is pressed if none of these buttons are present.

element.name: MessageDlg.Result
element.short: The result of this function is either the button the user pressed to close the dialog, or mrCancel.

descr.p: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog expressed as an integer.
If the user clicks the [X]-bordericon, the return value will be mrCancel.
If the user presses the escape key, the result depends on the widgetset:

ul.li: If the widgetset has implemented a native dialog, the result will be mrCancel.

Otherwise the result will be mrCancel, mrNo or mrOk (in that order) if mbCancel, mbNo or mbOk is present. The dialog will not close when the Escape key is pressed if none of these buttons are present.

element.name: MessageDlg.aMsg
element.short: The message to be shown.
element.descr: The message shown to the user.

element.name: MessageDlg.DlgType
element.short: The type of dialog to be shown.

descr.p: The DlgType parameter indicates the type of dialog to show. You can choose from mtWarning, mtError, mtInformation, mtConfirmation or mtCustom.

element.name: MessageDlg.Buttons
element.short: Determines the buttons shown on the message dialog.

descr.p: Buttons indicate which set of button captions have to be shown on the dialog. You can choose from predefined sets:
Or, you can make your own set.

element.name: MessageDlg.HelpCtx

element.descr: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.

element.descr: Sets the caption of the message dialog shown by this function.

descr.p: This function performs the same function as the MessageDlg function. It has been extended with parameters to place the dialog on a certain position on the screen instead of in the center of the screen.
The MessageDlgPos function does not enable you to choose the caption of the dialog.

If the user presses the escape key, the result depends on the widgetset:

ul.li: If the widgetset has implemented a native dialog, the result will be mrCancel.

Otherwise the result will be mrCancel, mrNo or mrOk (in that order) if mbCancel, mbNo or mbOk is present. The dialog will not close when the Escape key is pressed if none of these buttons are present.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.aMsg
element.short: The message to be shown.
element.descr: The message shown to the user.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.DlgType
element.short: The type of dialog to be shown.

descr.p: The DlgType parameter indicates the type of dialog to show. You can choose from mtWarning, mtError, mtInformation, mtConfirmation or mtCustom.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.Buttons
element.short: Determines the buttons shown on the message dialog.

descr.p: Buttons indicate which buttons have to be shown on the dialog. You can choose from predefined sets:
Or, you can make your own set.

Otherwise the result will be mrCancel, mrNo or mrOk (in that order) if mbCancel, mbNo or mbOk is present. The dialog will not close when the Escape key is pressed if none of these buttons are present.

element.name: DefaultPromptDialog
element.short: Widgetset-independent implementation.

element.name: QuestionDlg
element.short: Show a question to the user and get a response.

descr.p: QuestionDlg has the same functionality as MessageDlg except for the parameter Buttons which is of a different type. You can define your own captions and return values of this function.

Buttons is a list of TModalResult (defined as constants [mrNone..MrYesToAll] in ) and strings. For each TModalResult a button is created. To set a custom caption, add a string after a button. You can use the special string parameters 'isdefault' and 'iscancel' to setup the default and cancel buttons.
The default TModalResults defined in controls.pp (mrNone..mrLast) don't need a caption. The default captions will be used.
You can mark one default button using the 'IsDefault' option. When the user presses 'Return' this button is triggered.

Some widgetsets provide an Escape key and/or a close button. This results in mrCancel even if it is not in the given button list. Use the 'IsCancel' option to redirect it to a button of your choice. You can combine 'IsDefault' and 'IsCancel'.

element.name: QuestionDlg.Result
element.short: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.
element.descr: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.

element.name: QuestionDlg.aCaption
element.short: Used to set the caption of the question dialog.
element.descr: Set the caption of the question dialog shown by this function.

element.name: QuestionDlg.aMsg
element.short: The question to be shown.
element.descr: The question the user has to answer.

element.name: QuestionDlg.DlgType
element.short: The type of dialog to be shown in fact which icon will be shown.

element.name: QuestionDlg.Buttons
element.short: An array of return values and caption for the buttons on the question dialog.

descr.p: Buttons is defined as a array of const. This means you can define any number of buttons to be shown. If your array consists of only predefined return values like mrOK and mrCancel, the standard OK and Cancel buttons will be shown.
The strength of this function is however that you can fill the array like:
This will create a dialog with three buttons; the captions for the buttons will be the strings values given in the array.
The return value of the function will be 400, 401 or 402, depending on whether the user clicked the 'Yes!!!', the 'Are you mad?' or the 'My mistake' button.

element.name: QuestionDlg.HelpCtx
