element.descr: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.

element.name: ShowMessage
element.short: Displays the specified message text.

descr.p: The simplest message dialog: takes a simple string as argument, displays it in a box, and waits for a mouse-click or enter-key event before returning to the calling routine or program.
This is a modal procedure call; the box is displayed, receives focus, and does not relinquish focus until the OK box is clicked or otherwise selected.

element.name: ShowMessage.aMsg
element.short: A string constant containing the message to be shown.
element.descr: A string constant containing the message to be shown.

element.name: ShowMessageFmt
element.short: Shows a message assembled from a format string and an array of arguments.

element.name: ShowMessageFmt.Params

element.name: InputBox
element.short: Displays a box with specified title and prompt, and accepts user input in a text box.

descr.p: A default string can optionally be displayed in the text box. The user-entered or default string is returned as the function result.
If the user selects the OK button, the text in the text box is returned. If the user selects the Cancel button, the default string is returned.

element.name: InputBox.Result
element.short: The result of this function is the string the user entered in the editbox or the default string.

element.name: InputBox.ACaption
element.short: The caption for the dialogbox.

element.name: InputBox.APrompt
element.short: The text asking the user for his input.

element.name: InputBox.ADefault
element.short: Default value for dialog box.
element.descr: The value of the editbox in the dialog will have this value.

element.name: PasswordBox
element.short: Displays a Password prompt with input masking.

descr.p: PasswordBox is a specialized form of InputQuery. The editbox on the dialog box will mask the input. The only parameters are aCaption and aPrompt.
Behaves very similarly to the InputQuery function with MaskInput set to TRUE; the difference is that the password that was typed in is returned as the result of the function (like InputBox).

element.name: PasswordBox.Result
element.short: The string the user entered.

element.name: PasswordBox.ACaption
element.short: The caption for the dialog.

element.name: PasswordBox.APrompt
element.short: A prompt to ask for the users input.

element.name: cInputQueryEditSizePixels

element.name: cInputQueryEditSizePercents

element.name: cInputQuerySpacingSize
element.short: Spacing between the controls on an Input Query dialog.

element.name: TSelectDirOpt

element.name: TSelectDirOpts
element.short: Set type for directory selection options.

element.name: SelectDirectory
element.short: A function that allows a user to select a directory.

descr.p: This function will show a dialog which allows the user to select the required directory when the directory structure is displayed as a tree.
Under Windows the caption from the resulting dialog cannot be set, but the label above the directory tree will have this value.
There are two version of this function, the second one having the ability to indicate whether hidden folders should be shown as well.

element.name: SelectDirectory.Result
element.short: A boolean indicating if the user pressed OK.
element.descr: A boolean indicating if the user selected a directory and pressed OK.

element.name: SelectDirectory.Caption
element.short: A constant which sets the caption of the shown dialog.
element.descr: A constant which sets the caption of the shown dialog.

element.name: SelectDirectory.InitialDirectory
element.short: The directory the dialog should start in.

descr.p: The directory the dialog should start in. If a valid directory is given, the selected directory in the tree will be set to this directory.

element.name: SelectDirectory.Directory
element.short: A variable which on exit contains the selected directory.
element.descr: A variable which on exit contains the selected directory.

element.name: SelectDirectory.ShowHidden
element.short: A boolean constant indicating whether hidden folders should be shown too.
element.descr: A boolean constant indicating whether hidden folders should be shown too.

element.name: InputQuery
element.short: Use InputQuery to show a dialog box to get input from the user.

descr.p: Two versions of this function which displays a prompt and expects user input of textual data.

The first includes a MaskInput boolean argument which determines whether the user input is masked out by asterisks in the text-input box (like during entry of a password). The second variant omits this argument. Omitting the MaskInput argument is equivalent to setting it to False.
Value contains the initial text displayed in the edit control for the dialog. The text entered by the user is also returned in the variable argument Value.
The function result is a boolean which returns True if the OK button was pressed, or False if the box was closed by any other mechanism (such as clicking the 'Close' icon on the top title bar).

Another overloaded variant allows Arrays with String values to be passed in the APrompts and AValues arguments. They are used to create labels and edit controls on the dialog form, where the user can supply multiple values. The number of labels and edit controls on the dialog is determined by the length of the AValues array. An exception is raised when the APrompts and AValues arrays do not have the same length.

An event handler routine can be provided in the ACloseEvent argument to validate the input values, and determine if the dialog can be closed. It is signalled when the input dialog is closed by clicking the Cancel button or the Close icon on the dialog form. The handler returns an Array of String values input using the dialog.

element.name: InputQuery.Result
element.short: Returns True of OK button was pressed, False if Cancel was pressed or abnormal exit.
element.descr: Result is True if the user pressed OK or hit RETURN in the dialog box. If the user pressed Cancel or the dialog was closed without pressing a button the result will be False.

element.name: InputQuery.ACaption
element.short: The caption for the dialogbox.

element.name: InputQuery.APrompt
element.short: The text asking the user for his input.

element.name: InputQuery.MaskInput
element.short: Determines if the dialog shows *s or the actual input.
element.descr: Set MaskInput to true if you want to hide the input and display asterisks.

element.name: InputQuery.Value
element.short: The value the user entered.

descr.p: When the DialogBox is shown the text in the edit control will be Value. This string can be altered or amended by the user. When ENTER is pressed or OK clicked, Value will contain the edited text from the dialog.

element.name: InputQuery.APrompts
element.short: Array with strings values used as labels on the input dialog.

element.name: InputQuery.AValues
element.short: Arrays with string values used in edit controls for the associated labels.

element.name: DefaultInputDialog

element.name: InputCombo.APrompt

element.name: InputCombo.AList

element.short: Displays an extended input combo-box dialog that allows entry of custom text values.

element.name: InputComboEx.ACaption
element.short: Caption for the dialog.

element.name: InputComboEx.APrompt
element.short: Prompt or label for the combo-box control.

element.name: InputComboEx.AList

element.name: InputComboEx.AllowCustomText
element.short: True to allow new values to be added to the combo-box control.

element.name: ExtractColorIndexAndColor
element.short: Extracts the color index and color value for the specified position in a color list.

element.name: ExtractColorIndexAndColor.Result
element.short: True on success, false if the list does not use the correct format.

element.name: ExtractColorIndexAndColor.AColorList
element.short: List of colors in COLORID=VALUE format.

element.name: ExtractColorIndexAndColor.AIndex
element.short: Position in the list for the extracted color index and value.

element.name: ExtractColorIndexAndColor.ColorIndex
element.short: Color index (ColorA=0, ColorB=1, etc.)

element.name: ExtractColorIndexAndColor.ColorValue
element.short: TColor for the hexadecimal value in the list.

element.name: GetDialogCaption
element.short: Gets the resource string used as the caption for the specified dialog identifier.

descr.p: The following dialog identifiers and return values are used in the routine:
The return value is '?' when an unknown value is used in the idDiag argument.

element.name: GetDialogCaption.Result
element.short: Default caption for the dialog identifier.

element.name: GetDialogCaption.idDiag
element.short: Identifier for the dialog type, i. e. idDialogWarning or idDialogError.

element.name: GetDialogIcon
element.short: Gets a bitmap with the icon for the specified dialog identifier.

descr.p: The bitmap may contain a stock image provided by theme services (when available), or a PNG image image loaded from a Lazarus resource in the application.

element.name: GetDialogIcon.Result
element.short: Bitmap with the icon for the dialog identifier.

element.name: GetDialogIcon.idDiag
element.short: Identifier for the dialog type, i. e. idDialogWarning or idDialogShield.

element.name: Register
element.short: Registers components for use in the Lazarus IDE.

descr.p: Register is the procedure used to register components for use in the Lazarus IDE.
The following components are added to the Component Palette in the Lazarus IDE:
Dialogs Tab
Misc Tab
